title: List of municipalities in California
text:
<a href="California">California</a> is a <a href="U.S.%20state">state</a> located in the <a href="Western%20United%20States">Western United States</a>. It is the <a href="List%20of%20U.S.%20states%20and%20territories%20by%20population">most populous state</a> and the <a href="List%20of%20U.S.%20states%20and%20territories%20by%20area">third largest by area</a> after <a href="Alaska">Alaska</a> and <a href="Texas">Texas</a>. According to the <a href="2020%20United%20States%20Census">2020 United States Census</a>, California has 39,538,223 inhabitants and of land.
California has been inhabited by numerous <a href="Indigenous%20peoples%20of%20California">Native American</a> peoples since antiquity. The <a href="Spanish%20colonization%20of%20the%20Americas">Spanish</a>, the <a href="Russian%20colonization%20of%20the%20Americas">Russian</a>s, and other Europeans began exploring and colonizing the area in the 16th and 17th centuries, with the Spanish establishing its first California <a href="Spanish%20missions%20in%20California">mission</a> at what is now <a href="Presidio%20of%20San%20Diego">San Diego</a> in 1769. After the <a href="Mexican%20Cession">Mexican Cession</a> of 1848, the <a href="California%20Gold%20Rush">California Gold Rush</a> brought worldwide attention to the area. The growth of the <a href="Cinema%20of%20the%20United%20States">movie industry</a> in <a href="Los%20Angeles">Los Angeles</a>, <a href="high%20tech">high tech</a> in <a href="San%20Francisco">San Francisco</a> and <a href="Silicon%20Valley">Silicon Valley</a>, <a href="Tourism%20in%20the%20United%20States">tourism</a>, <a href="agriculture">agriculture</a>, and other areas in the ensuing decades fueled the creation of a $3 trillion <a href="Economy%20of%20California">economy</a> , which would rank fifth in the world if the state were a sovereign nation.
California is divided into 58 <a href="List%20of%20counties%20in%20California">counties</a> and contains 482 <a href="Local%20government%20in%20the%20United%20States">municipalities</a>. One, San Francisco, is a <a href="consolidated%20city-county">consolidated city-county</a>. California law makes no distinction between "city" and "town", and municipalities may use either term in their official names. They can be organized as either a <a href="Charter%20city">charter municipality</a>, governed by its own charter, or a <a href="general-law%20municipality">general-law municipality</a> (or "code city"), governed by state statute.
The first municipality to incorporate was <a href="Sacramento%2C%20California">Sacramento</a> on February 27, 1850, while the most recent was <a href="Jurupa%20Valley%2C%20California">Jurupa Valley</a> on July 1, 2011. Eight cities were incorporated before the state's September 9, 1850, admission to the Union. The largest municipality by population and land area is Los Angeles with 3,792,621 residents and . <a href="Amador%20City">Amador City</a> is the smallest municipality by population with 200 people and the smallest by land area at .
